org.pesullivan.game.mill.ui
Class MillApplet

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  org.pesullivan.game.mill.ui.MillApplet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public final class MillApplet
extends java.applet.Applet

An applet based Nine Mens Morris web game UI. All mouse based interactions required by the game take place within this applet. For those who are visually impaired, text based interactions take place outside the applet on a dynamic HTML page. The HTML page forwards the user's text based commands to the applet via Javascript calls.

See Also:
org.pesullivan.game.mill.engine, Serialized Form

GetAppletSceneParameters

public java.lang.String GetAppletSceneParameters()
Return applet parameters for the current scene. This method is used by an Easter egg that lets you manipulate the position of the game board against the scene background. After manipulating the board into position this method gives you 3D coordinates of the board that can be used as applet parameters for the selected scene background image. The Easter egg is activated by clicking on the top left corner of the applet panel. You can then manipulate the board by moving the mouse with the left button down. Different panel regions yeild different kinds of rotation. You then click on the web counter number on the web page to invoke this method and display the parameters via a Javascript prompt.

doCommand

public java.lang.String doCommand(java.lang.String command)
Parse a text based command and if it is syntactically valid then invoke it. This feature allows text based play for visually impaired players. Available commands are documented in Instructions for the Visually Impaired.

Parameters:
command -
Returns:
result message.
